dacbench.envs.policies package¶

Submodules¶

dacbench.envs.policies.bestknown_onell module¶

dacbench.envs.policies.bestknown_onell.get_dyn_onefifth(env, state)¶

return the best lambda using 1/5th success rule (see [Doerr, Doerr, Ebel TCS 2015]) only applicable when env.config.name is lbd_onefifth and env.config.problem is OneMax

dacbench.envs.policies.bestknown_onell.get_dyn_theory(env, state)¶

return the best lambda known by theory (see [Doerr, Doerr, Ebel TCS 2015]) only applicable when env.config.name is lbd_theory and env.config.problem is OneMax

dacbench.envs.policies.csa_cma module¶

dacbench.envs.policies.csa_cma.csa(env, state)¶

dacbench.envs.policies.optimal_fd module¶

dacbench.envs.policies.optimal_fd.get_optimum(env, state)¶

dacbench.envs.policies.optimal_luby module¶

dacbench.envs.policies.optimal_luby.get_optimum(env, state)¶
dacbench.envs.policies.optimal_luby.luby_gen(i)¶

Generator for the Luby Sequence

dacbench.envs.policies.optimal_sigmoid module¶

dacbench.envs.policies.optimal_sigmoid.get_optimum(env, state)¶
dacbench.envs.policies.optimal_sigmoid.sig(x, scaling, inflection)¶

Simple sigmoid function
